rows.title: Welcome to Parenting for Respectability
rows.goal_1: In this lesson, you will learn about Parenting for Respectability. How the programme works and what to expect.

Strong relationships are the fertile soil from which all good things grow. In this course, you’ll learn why family relationships matter, especially those with your spouse and child, and you’ll learn how to recruit your partner to join this learning journey with you!
In this lesson, we’ll explore what your *current* parenting practices and beliefs are and set some goals together!

In this lesson, we will explore the phases of child development from age 0-17. 

Did you know that fathers play an important role in pregnancy and childhood development? Good parenting helps children reach their full potential!
rows.goal_3: * Importance of parenting practices for children to reach their full potential.

rows.goal_1:
If we reflect back on our own childhood, we can remember what moments of positive parenting felt like! In this lesson, we’re going to reflect on how the influence of our parent figures affect our own parenting today. 

We can uphold the positive influence of our parent figures while we parent our children today.
In this lesson, you’ll learn what positive parent-child interaction is and the different styles of parenting which promote positive relationships and respectability.
In this lesson, you’ll learn about the different styles of parenting and select one to focus on for your family.
In this lesson, you’ll learn how gender norms can be harmful to both women and men, girls and boys.

In this lesson, you will reflect on your own experiences with spousal conflict and you will learn about the effects of spousal conflict on parenting and how to begin building relationships built on respect.
rows.goal_3: * Envision intimate relationships based on respect.

rows.goal_1: Men are made for parenting. In this lesson, you’ll reflect on the time men and women spend parenting and learn how to feel confident stepping in.
In this lesson, you’ll learn what a healthy marriage and sexuality is and the important role that fathers play during pregnancy and after birth.

In this lesson, you’ll learn the difference between **punishment** and **discipline** and how each effects our children and their behaviour. You’ll also learn anger management techniques to use when your children disappoint you and how to promote respect in your home.
Parents can shape a child’s success at school. In this lesson, you’ll learn how to support your child’s education so they can achieve their potential.

Have you ever disagreed with your spouse on how to raise your children? Often, men and women see things differently. In this lesson, we’ll learn why that is and how to resolve these challenges together.
In this lesson we will learn how to protect our children from sexual abuse and early sex.
In this lesson, we’ll learn how to resolve conflicts without violence.

rows.title: Conclusion
rows.goal_1: The goal of this lesson is to reflect on everything you have learned and celebrate what you have accomplished!
